title: At least 8 killed in crush at Travis Scott concert
Prevea Health and Aaron Rodgers end partnership
description: Prevea Health announced on Saturday it is ending its partnership with Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers, who tested positive for Covid-19 earlier this week and is unvaccinated against the virus.

title: Rapper releases his first statement after at least eight people died and scores of others were injured at his concert
Video shows moment Travis Scott spots ambulance in crowd
description: At least eight people died and many others were injured after a crowd surged forward at the music festival in Houston.

title: El Chapo's brother and 2 others indicted on drug trafficking charges
description: The US Attorney's office in Arizona announced the unsealing of two indictments that charged high-ranking members of the Sinaloa drug cartel with international drug trafficking, one of them the brother of Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman, the convicted former leader of the cartel.

title: Manchester United suffer another embarrassing defeat
description: Manchester United slumped to a fourth defeat of the Premier League season at Old Trafford on Saturday, going down 2-0 against rival Manchester City.

title: At least 98 killed in Sierra Leone fuel tanker explosion
description: At least 84 people died on Friday after a fuel tanker exploded in a suburb of Sierra Leone's capital, Freetown, according to authorities in the West African country.

title: The search for another Earth across the galaxy heats up
description: I've always been a bit dazzled by the fact that, as humans, we truly are made of star stuff. This week, an element found in our teeth was detected for the first time in a galaxy 12 billion light-years away.

title: Climate change is teaching the Dutch to let land flood
description: In the spitting rain that is endemic to the Netherlands, Anneke van Lelieveld bundles up in her bright orange cardigan at her home on the New Merwede River, and turns to look out over the wetlands behind her garden.

title: Woman arrested after fourth death in paddleboarding incident
description: A woman has been arrested on suspicion of gross negligence manslaughter following a paddleboarding incident in Wales last week in which four people died.

title: Ethiopia's military calls on former members to rejoin army as rebels advance on capital
description: Ethiopia's military is calling on veterans to rejoin the army as two aligned rebel groups threaten the capital, marking the latest sign the government is marshaling its power to defend Addis Ababa.

title: A dangerous crisis is brewing in the Balkans. Will the West do anything to stop another war?
description: The Balkan state of Bosnia-Herzegovina is on the verge of what analysts warn is its most serious crisis since the end of the Bosnian war in 1995, in which thousands were killed and horrendous acts of ethnic cleansing were committed.

title: Ahmaud Arbery's mother wept as body cam video played during the first day of trial
description: Ahmaud Arbery's mother put her head in her hands and wept as body cam video that showed the aftermath of her son's shooting was played in court Friday.

title: Idris Elba warns of future food shortages from the climate crisis
Camels escape from circus and venture out to explore Madrid
description: Spanish police had an unusual encounter on Friday night when a number of camels and a llama escaped from a circus and wandered onto the Madrid streets.

title: 'Go be happy': Thousands of baby river turtles released in Peruvian jungle
description: Some 3,000 baby river turtles native to the Amazon rainforest were released into a Peruvian river on Thursday after hatching from eggs kept on artificial beaches as part of a conservation effort.

title: Kenenisa Bekele ready to 'make more history' as the New York City Marathon returns
description: The New York City Marathon returns on Sunday following a two-year hiatus, and at the front of the field, legendary distance runner Kenenisa Bekele is primed to "make more history" in his storied career.

title: British Sikh Army officer aims to be first woman of color to ski solo to South Pole
description: Preet Chandi is aiming to make history. The British-born Indian Sikh Army officer is embarking November 7 on the long voyage to Antarctica. Once there, she hopes to become the first woman of color to ski solo and unsupported to the South Pole.

title: 'Some kind of crowd surge': Music festival in Houston turns deadly
Barcelona appoints club legend Xavi as new coach
description: Barcelona has announced the appointment of club legend Xavi Hernández as the club's new coach on a deal that includes the remainder of the current season plus two additional seasons.

title: Police searching for missing swimmer after a shark attack in Western Australia
description: A man is missing after a reported shark attack at a beach in North Fremantle, Western Australia according to police and the state government.

title: Russia and China fight record Covid outbreaks
description: Russia and China are fighting record Covid outbreaks, US domestic air travel is set to go from bad to worse, but there's good news out of Asia-Pacific.

title: The NBA's burgeoning tattoo culture has created a new type of influencer
description: On any given night, NBA games are a showdown between some of the best basketball professionals in the world. But increasingly, the courts are not just stages for athletes showing their physical prowess -- they've also become an exhibition of some of the best, and most interesting, tattoos.

title: Wife pesters husband to buy lottery ticket. It hits for $2.4 million
description: A Missouri couple is $2.4 million richer thanks to a persistent wife.

title: These Republicans are worried about Trump's attempted coup 2.0
Congress passes $1.2 trillion bipartisan infrastructure bill, delivering major win for Biden
2 students charged with first-degree murder in death of  teacher
description: Two 16-year-old high school students have been charged with first-degree murder in the death of a Spanish teacher at their Iowa school, court documents show.

title: Marília Mendonça, chart-topping Brazilian musician, dies in plane crash
description: Brazilian country music star Marília Mendonça died in a plane crash on Friday in a rural region of the southeastern state of Minas Gerais, according to her public relations firm.

title: Woman battling cancer survives bear attack in her cabin
description: A woman is recovering and says she feels lucky to be alive after being mauled by a black bear that broke into her Lake Tahoe cabin and rummaged through her kitchen.

title: Delhi pollution levels soar after residents defy Diwali fireworks ban
description: Air quality in India's capital dipped to 'hazardous' levels Friday after the festival of Diwali was celebrated with the usual widespread use of fireworks, defying a citywide ban.

title: My father is imprisoned in Nicaragua. His fate could hang on their upcoming presidential election
description: Last year, like many people across the US, I couldn't imagine feeling more anxious about a presidential election than I did in November 2020. In the weeks leading up to the vote, I followed every twist of an often surreal and harrowing campaign.

title: Looted African artifacts being returned more than 100 years later
description: European museums are working to repatriate its Benin bronzes, which were looted by the British in an 1897 raid on the royal palace. CNN's Scott McLean reports.
